titleInfo.title: The University of Tennessee record for 1898
University of Tennessee record, volume 1, number 1

mods.abstract: This publication contains the official actions and announcements of the Board of Trustees and of the Alumni association, the reports of the faculties and officers of the institution, the calendar of University exercises, meetings of societies, and public lectures. It serves as the complete record of the Alumni and former students of the University. This issue begins with an abstract of an address on "Culture Studies in Scientific and Engineering Courses" by University of Tennessee President Charles W. Dabney.
mods.note: Six times a year.

name.namePart: Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 1, number 2

mods.abstract: This publication contains the official actions and announcements of the Board of Trustees and of the Alumni association, the reports of the faculties and officers of the institution, the calendar of University exercises, meetings of societies, and public lectures. This issue begins with a historical overview and discussion of women's education and participation in the University of Tennessee.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 1, number 3

mods.abstract: This announcement issue contains information regarding admissions, accredidations, course offerings, class schedules, tuition and fees, and degree requirements . This issue begins with an asbtract of an address on "Making the Perfect Man" by University of Tennessee President Charles W. Dabney, followed by a report on "The Public High School and the College" produced by Dr. George F. Mellen, a University of Tennessee professor of Greek.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 2, number 4

mods.abstract: The issue contains a historical overview and list of the alumni association for the University of Tennessee. A list of book notices follows.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 2, number 5

mods.abstract: This publication contains a biographical list of the trustees and presidents of the University of Tennessee and its historic predecessors. This issue begins with an address on Thomas W. Humes, a president of East Tennessee University.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 2, number 6

mods.abstract: This issue begins with an address by Dr. Edward S. Joynes, "The University and the State", delivered June 14, 1898 during commencement. Details of the 1898 University of Tennessee commencement follow, including the alumni banquet address and toasts, senior activities, graduating excercises, literary society celebrations, and a complete record of 1898 graduates. The issue also contains a roster of University of Tennessee alumni, officers, and students involved in the Spanish War and memoriam of those killed in battle at the time of publication. The issue concludes with the actions of the Board of Trustees.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 2, number 7

mods.abstract: This issue begins with an announcement celebrating the construction and completion of Estabrook Hall, a building designated for the department of Mechanical Engineering and Mechanic Arts. A detailed overview of the "Nutrition Investigations at the University of Tennessee" follows. The investigations consisted of several research studies analyizing the nutrition and composition of local and regional diets, as directed by the United States Department of Agriculture and funded by Congress. This issue also contains a collection of University of Tennessee research initiatives pertaining to engineering, physics, photography, and natural sciences. The issue concludes with an alumni feature titled "What Some of Our Graduates are Doing", a list of recent scientific theses at the University of Tennessee, and an index to volume 1 of the Tennessee Record.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 2, number 8

mods.abstract: This publication contains the official actions and announcements of the Board of Trustees and of the Alumni association, the reports of the faculties and officers of the institution, summary of students, and an overview of religious work at the University. This issue begins with an abstract of an address on "The State University in the Constitutions and the Laws" by University of Tennessee President Charles W. Dabney.
mods.note: Entered at the post office at Knoxville as second-class mail matter.

mods.note: Entered at the post office at Knoxville as second-class mail matter.

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 2, number 10

mods.abstract: This issue begins with a biography of Joseph Estabrook, the fifth President of the University of Tennessee. Details of the 1899 University of Tennessee commencement follow, including the alumni banquet address and toasts, senior activities, graduating excercises, literary society celebrations, and a complete record of 1899 graduates. The 1899 commencement address, "The Revival of Interest in Southern Letters, and a Plea for Preservation of the Southland's Past", was delivered by Dr. Charles W. Kent, Professor of English Literature at the University of Virginia.

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 3, number 13

mods.abstract: This publication describes the activities of the agriculture department at the University of Tennessee. Agricultural facilities, including laboratories and the University farm, as well as the department's methods of instruction and research endeavors. Dairy farming, orchard renovation, soil studies, and botanical work are highlighted areas of University research exploration.

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 3, number 15

mods.abstract: This publication contains a roster of the University's Board of Trustees, the Alumni association, and officers of government and instruction. A brief history of the University precedes an overview of University admissions, campus life, tuition and lodging expenses, and scholarships. Sections devoted to the University's agricultural, engineering, and academic departments follow, with detailed course descriptions, facilties, and program objectives for each. The issue concludes with a complete schedule of classes, College of Law announcement, and attendance record for the 1899-1900 academic year.
mods.note: Entered at the post office at Knoxville as second-class mail matter.

This issue also contains the College of Law's 1898 prize thesis winner, "Injunction Against Intimidation", as well as a general announcement from the College regarding the 1900-1901 academic session.
mods.note: Entered at the post office at Knoxville as second-class mail matter.

mods.abstract: Record from 1974 promoting the campuses of the University of Tennessee system. It shares information on fields of study, activities, and buildings for each of the campuses - Knoxville, Center for the Health Services, Martin, Chattanooga, and Nashville.
mods.note: Published monthly except February, April, June, and August

titleInfo.title: Progress vs. the shrinking dollar; 1973-74 annual report of Edward J. Boling, president, the University of Tennessee to the board of trustees, June 20, 1974
University of Tennessee record, volume 77, number 5

mods.abstract: Record for the 1973-1974 academic year centered on the theme "Progress vs. the Shrinking Dollar." The issue contains reports from the chancellors of the five UT campuses - Knoxville, Center for the Health Services, Martin, Chattanooga, and Nashville. Developments from the Division of Continuing Education, Institute of Agriculture, and Institute for Public Service are also included.
mods.note: Published monthly except February, April, June, and August

titleInfo.title: Report on research and publications 1973, with a catalog of publications of the faculty and staff and a list of doctors' dissertations and masters' theses
University of Tennessee record, volume 77, number 6

mods.abstract: Report containing publications by faculty and staff listed by academic college as well as doctors' and masters' completed in 1973. The scope of these publications indicates the varied disciplines represented by the University of Tennessee. The bulletin includes an index of authors.
mods.note: Published monthly except February, April, June, and August

titleInfo.title: The University of Tennessee record; graduate studies / 1975 / Knoxville
University of Tennessee record, volume 78, number 1

mods.abstract: This publication contains the graduate school catalogue for 1975 for the University of Tennessee. It includes the board of trustees members, general information about admission, administration members, the curriculum, session calendar, and index.

titleInfo.title: University of Tennessee record, volume 78, number 4

mods.abstract: Record promoting the campuses of the University of Tennessee system to potential applicants. The issue's theme is "Five-in-One: The Five Campuses of UT." It answers questions about the cost of attendance, housing, fields of study, and activities for each of the campuses - Knoxville, Center for the Health Services, Martin, Chattanooga, and Nashville.
